location: England, London, St. Dunstan's Hill, Lower Thames Street
description: A site excavated in 1967, it was described as a small 'temple-like' building, it formed a single room with an eastern facing entrance and evidence for red and pink painted walls.
bibliography: Hall, J, and J Shepherd. “Places of Worship in Roman London and Beyond.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, 2008.
Perring, D, and T Brigham. “Londinium and Its Hinterland: The Roman Period.” The Archaeology of Greater London, 2000, 135.
Schofield, John. “Guildhall Museum Archive Guide - Draft,” n.d.
